info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Thomas and northeastern Logan Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1200 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Russell Springs, or 15 miles southwest of Oakley, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Monument around 1215 AM CDT. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 68 and 75. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for northwestern Kansas.
